title: Not a good practice to hardcode sample name in body of the function
body:
```
def VCFBodyLine(rec, alts, genotype, p, VCF_out):
        record = VCF_out.header.new_record()
        record.contig = rec.seq
        record.ref = rec.ref
        record.alts = alts
        record.pos = rec.pos
        record.samples['HCC1143BL']['GT'] = genotype
        record.samples['HCC1143BL']['VAF'] = str(p)
```

title: Run program from the command line
body:
The majority of bioinformatics tools are able to be run from command line. Please make this variant caller as python script that parses cmd line arguments (pileup name and p) and outputs VCF on stdout or in the file if file name with "-o" parameter is given. 
docopt is convenient for this purpose.

title: Put all images in images directory
First allele, second allele
body: By the "first allele" do you mean major allele, and by "second allele" minor allele? If yes, maybe use these terms, they are more commonly used.

title: Please add link to YT video presentation to README.md
Please add some small test pileup
body: Please add ~500KB size pileup in test directory so the user could test the script. Also, change test example run in README.md.

title: Give your baby a name
body: It deserves a better name than part1_VCF.py :)
